src_text: Pego ya Kopano ya Kabinete ya la 28 Dibokwane 2018Kabinete e kopane ka Laboraro la 28 Dibokwane 2018, ka Tuynhuys, Motsekapa Merero seemong sa bjale1.
trg_text: Cabinet met on Wednesday, 28 February 2018, at Tuynhuys, Cape Tow Issues in the environment1.

src_text: Polelo ya Ditekanyet o t a Boset haba Kabinete e leboga tshepho ye kgolo yeo e laedit wego ka go Ditekanyet o t a Boset haba t a 2018 t eo di adilwego ka Palamenteng, Motsekapa, bekeng ye e fetileg Ka moya wo o sa t wago go bonwa wa tso olo o wo o tsenego ka nageng ya rena ye botse, Kabinete e ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa ka moka go diri ana le mmu o ka nepo ya go godi a ekonomi ya rena le go hloma me omo ye e nyakegago kud Phokot o ya tshenyegelo ka R85 pilione mo mengwageng ye meraro ye e latelago go laet a boikgafo bja mmu o go tii et o ya seemo sa dit helete le kabo ya methopo ye e nago le
trg_text: Cabinet appreciates the overwhelming confidence expressed in the 2018 National Budget which was tabled in Parliament, Cape Town, last wee In the recent spirit of renewal that has gripped our great nation, Cabinet calls on all South Africans to partner with government to grow our economy and create much-needed job The reduction in expenditure of R85 billion over the next three years demonstrates government s commitment to fiscal consolidation and the prudent allocation of resources to grow the econom

src_text: edi ka nepo ya go godi a ekonom Dikgato t eo di tsebagadit wego t a go nant ha lebelo la go ba le dikoloto le go laola tlhaelelo ya ditekanyet o di kaonafat a kudu tlhako ya rena ya dit helete le go fa maAfrika Borwa boitshepo go dikgonagalo t a ka moso t a ekonomi ya ren Kabinete ga e tekateke gore ditsenogare t e di tla bonagala ka go kgolo ya ekonomi ya naga ya rena, t a tii et a seemo sa ekonomi le go
trg_text: The steps announced to slow the pace of debt accumulation and contain the budget deficit greatly improve our fiscal framework and give South Africans confidence in the future prospects of our econom

src_text: irelet a maemo a kelo ya dipeelet o t a yon Ditekanyet o t a Boset haba t a 2018 di thekga bahloki ka set habeng sa rena ka go diri a lenaneokakaret o la thu o ya set haba le thuto ya godingwana ya go se lefelwe go baithuti bao ba t wago malapeng a go hlok Bjalo ka phetolo go ngongorego yeo e t weledit wego mabapi le t hi inyo ya koket o ya Mot helo wa bete (BETE), Kabinete e nyaka go oket a lenaneo la dithoto t a motheo t eo di sa lefi wego mot helo wa bete Mokete wa Mengwaga ye Lekgolo wa Nelson Mandela Kabinete e ba le Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa ge a ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa go tii et a boikgafo bja rena ka moka bja go direla batho ge re t wela pele go keteka mengwaga ye lekgolo go tloga mola Mopresidente wa peleng Nelson Mandela a belegwag Madiba e bile Mopresidente wa mathomo wa Afrika Borwa ya Temokrasi gomme nkabe a tlo ba le mengwaga ye 100 ka la 18 Phupu 2012.
trg_text: A number of events will be held throughout the country this year to reflect on the life of Tata Madib Cabinet calls upon all South Africans to join in the centenary celebrations in their workplaces, schools, churches and civic organisation It calls on each one of us this year to emulate the values of Nelson Mandela by working in our respective ways to build a united, non-racist, non-sexist and prosperous countr The country also celebrates the centenary of one of the great daughters of the African soil Mama Albertina Sisulu, who dedicated her life to fight for the emancipation of women and the liberation of South Afric

src_text: Madiba ke moetapele yo a tumilego lefaseng ka bophara yo a hlomphegago lefaseng ka moka bjalo ka Molweladikokelo t a Botho, tlhokego ya semorafe le tlhokego ya kgethologanyo ya bon O ralokile tema ye bohlokwa go kopanya maAfrika Borwa, le go hlohlelet a kwano ya temokrasi go ralala le Afrika le lefase ka bophar Moketeko wa mathomo wa mengwaga ye lekgolo ya Nelson Mandela e swerwe ka Sebokeng sa Mokgatlo wa Selekane sa Afrika ka Addis Ababa, Ethiopia ka Pherekgong 2018.
trg_text: Madiba is a global icon who is revered worldwide as a Champion of Human Rights, non-racism and non-sexis He played a critical role in unifying South Africans, and inspiring democratic unity across Africa and the glob The first celebration of Nelson Mandela s centenary took place during the African Union Summit in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia in January 2018.

src_text: Ditiragalo t e mmalwa di tlo swarwa naga ka bophara mo ngwageng wo go gopodi i a ka ga bophelo bja Tata Madib Kabinete e ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa go tsenela mekete ya mengwaga ye lekgolo ka me omong ya bona, dikolong, dikerekeng le mekgatlong ya set hab E ipilet a go yo mongwe le yo mongwe wa rena go eki a mekgwa ya Nelson Mandela ka go

trg_text: Cabinet joins President Cyril Ramaphosa in his call on South Africans to reaffirm a shared commitment to serve people as we continue to celebrate the centenary of the birth of former President Nelson Mandel Madiba is the first President of a Democratic South Africa and would have turned 100 years of age on 18 July 2012.

src_text: Sehlophat homo sa Ditona ka ga Komelelo se t wela pele go nolopfat a mo omo gareng ga mmu o wa boset haba, ga diprofense le mebasepala ka mafelong ka moka ao a amilwego ke komelel Se se akaret a go tsenya tiri ong magato lebaka le lekopana, la magareng le le letelele ka nepo ya go rarolla le go fokot a seabe seo se ka kgonegago sa komelelo y Mmu o o dirile gore go be le dit helete t a go aba thu o ya lebaka le lekopana go diprofense t e di amegag O abile thu o ya dit helete t a kimollo t e di bago R473 milione le R6 pilione ya tlalelet o ka ngwageng wa dit helete wa 2018/19 ka nepo ya go oket a mananeokgoparara a meetse ka Kapa Bodikela

src_text: Kabinete e dumelet e Sethalwa seo se Bu eledit wego sa Sengwalwa sa Ditheri ano ka ga Melawana ya Dinamelwa ya Boset haba seo se tlogo phatlalat wa gore set haba se fe ditshwaotshwao ka ga son Melawana ye e ikemi edit e go hlagi a tshepedi o ya dinamelwa yeo e kopant wego le maano a mafapha a mangwe ao a amanego go realo e le go fokot a bobedi tshenyegelo ya go namela dinamelwa le ya go dira kgweb E nyalelanya gape maano a dinamelwa a naga ye le diphetogo t a lefaseng ka bophara ka ga dinamelwa Kabinete e dumelet e Pego ya Dit hit inyo ka ga Melawana ya Ditsela ya Afrika Borwa gore e phatlalat we gore set haba se fe ditshwaotshwao ka ga yon Melawana ye e hlagi a tlhako ya kakaret o yeo e netefat ago gore ditsela t a Afrika Borwa di laolwa gabotse, di bolokegile ebile di akaret a mekgwa ka moka ya dinamelwa ka nepo ya go fana ka mokgwa wa go ya go ile go taolo ya ditsel E hlahla ka ga melaotshepet o ya ditsela, mananeokgoparara, polokego, thu o ya dit helete t a ditsela le ya dinamelwa t eo e sego t a difatanaga Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga dikutollo t a Dinyaki i o t a Boset haba t a 2015/16 t alhabollo ya Dinyaki i o le Boitekelo (Dinyaki i o t a R&D).
trg_text: Cabinet approved the Draft Revised White Paper on National Transport Policy to be published for public comment The policy aims to provide a transport system that is integrated with other related sector plans so as to reduce both the cost of commuting and doing busines It also aligns the country s transportation plans to the global transportation trends Cabinet approved the Green Paper on Roads Policy for South Africa to be published for public comment The policy provides the overarching framework that ensures South Africa s roads are better managed, safer and include all modes of transport to deliver a sustainable approach to roads managemen It guides the road regulations, infrastructure, safety, road funding and non- motorised transport

trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Customary Initiation Bill of 2018 to Parliamen The Bill seeks to protect, promote and regulate the governance aspect of the practice of customary initiatioIt provides national norms and standards aimed at the protection of life and the prevention of injuries and all forms of abuse experienced by initiates Cabinet approved for the submission of the National Qualifications Framework Amendment Bill of 2016 to Parliamen The Bill, which amends the National Qualifications Framework Act, 2008 (Act 67 of 2008), strengthens the Act by improving measures to deal with issues of misrepresentation, imposes consequences on persons who misrepresent their qualifications or organisations that issue invalid qualificationIt also proposes regulations to ensure that fraudulent qualifications are referred to the relevant professional bodies (database of individuals who misrepresented their qualifications).
